content.description: SDS matched in jug pod. Climb tricky and consistent moves directly up the arete.
content.location: Around the corner of Nightmare Moon.

content.description:
OffwidthThis gorgeous inviting crack just grabs your body and invites some solid thrutchy scooting all the way up to the top. Sit start on each face of the crack with the nice left hand hold. Huck your shoulder into the crack and away you go. For maximum style points only use feet that are inside the crack from the arete, rather than feet on the face. There are two nice left feet that act as rests with plenty of fun in between.

 Recommend having a right-knee pad of some kind.
content.location: Stay inside the crack by Sunset Shimmer.

content.description:
Sit start with an undercling and a sidepull & climb to the top. Huge shout-out to Joel for having the vision and cleaning up this block. This has to be one of the best lines in the park.. maybe even the state. Second ascent - Duffy.

 Update - originally did as a stand, seems like the original left hand broke, but there's a lower left hand and the move still goes

Sit start left on slightly overhanging block and climb up the middle of face on small holds. The crux is a throw to the break, perfect jugs for the top out.  

  We built up a small landing since it slants severely down hill. It's still pretty terrible so be careful.
content.protection: Pads. A spotter would be helpful.

content.description: Start as for Nightmare Moon, sitting with left hand on the arete and right with a low edge.  Traverse right, staying low through the face.  Gain the arete and top out, moving slightly right on good holds. Kind of alotta moves and packs a bit of a punch.
content.protection: Pads.  Pretty low to the ground..  The landing does have a slant though.
content.location: Nightmare Moon Boulder. The climb faces north and it’s on the east side of the over look.

content.description: In the center of the north slope.
